result.execSummary:
Lavell James Brown was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Lavell James Brown was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Faun Michelle Moses in court.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has been extradited.

Defendant Lavell James Brown in court in custody with attorney Faun Michelle Moses.  Scott Henry Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Lavell James Brown in court in custody with attorney Faun Michelle Moses.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond of $5000 set. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 1-6-16 at 1:15pm.
